title: PHPinet_pton()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPinet_pton()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Convert a readable IP address into a packed format:
<?php
$addr = inet_pton("127.0.1.1");
echo $addr;
?>
Definition and Usage
The inet_pton() function converts a readable IP address into a packed 32bit IPv4 or 128bit IPv6 
format.
Syntax
inet_pton(
address
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
address
Required. Specifies a readable IP address
Technical Details
Return Value:
The address as a packed 32bit IPv4 or 128bit IPv6 format. FALSE on failure
PHP Version:
5.1+
PHP Changelog:
PHP 5.3: Now available on Windows platforms

★
+1
